moves.8... Nc6 9. h3 Bxf3 10. Qxf3 d4: the next move is a mistake on whites part. (i wanted to push d4 for awhile, but needed more backup.)
moves.11. cxd4 Nxd4 12. Bxd4 Qxd4: Xb2, possible mate in the future from an open king, this works on so many levels.  not to mention that, if all else fails, I get free c5
moves.13... Qxb2 14. cxb7 Rd8: as long as the rook is trapped at a1, I might as well not mess with it
moves.15. Ba6: Qd2, if only that N wasn't there...
moves.15... Qxa1: free rooks = good game for me
moves.16. O-O Qxa2 17. Qc6+ Nd7 18. Qc8 Qxa6 1: this was just error on whites part. thats not any strategy or anything.
moves.20... Rdxc8 21. bxc8=Q Rxc8 22. Rxc8+ Qx: now up a queen, a minor and a pawn, this game is over for white. I'm up 13 points, and have taken two queens away from white, leaving him a night and a corner.
moves.23... Bd6: possible mate with Qc1#, but I should have done Qc1 for the night.
moves.27... Ne4 28. Ng4 Nf6: I missed awesome attack with Nxg3, for mate. with Qh1#
